pEikfgRmIHFtlpCp_XomTQ.text: This place was recommended to me by the staff at the Norfolk Plaza Hotel, as I was checking out, having missed breakfast, and very hung-over after my friend's wedding the night before, and with an hour to kill before the car service would take me to the airport. I figured a full English Breakfast would be just what the doctor ordered, along with lots of hydrating beverages, like OJ, sparkling water, and peppermint tea. It was glorious. Friendly and timely service, and a ridiculously large and satisfying meal. Just what I needed.

Pkyu0GSsicoA3AtuKZSSeA.text: Went in for lunch on a Saturday.  Small place with table service although it looks like counter service when you walk in.Had two decent sandwiches, an order of chips and a hot tea. The portions were large... we had to take the remainder home.  All that with friendly service for under £10. Seriously.  Will definitely try it again for breakfast or dinner.

WgVNFKOJN9S0D1rGodJN_Q.text: This is an old school London Italian cafe. The sort of place you come for the atmosphere, homely food and friendly efficient service rather than the decor.Don't get me wrong, the wooden tables rattan chairs and basic decor may have seen better days but this place is spotless and comforting. Like any good Italian cafe they have footie on the TV and it's a warm inviting place to hang out even if you only want coffee and pastries.The menu ranges from salads to meat, fish and pasta with something for everyone. While my spaghetti Bolognese was competent rather than outstanding, it was a good plate of warming, tasty food for very little money and every dish that came out to the tables around me looked and smelled good.I really liked Mimo's, I left feeling comforted and full and am glad it's right next door to my regular London hotel. I will drop by often if I am in the area.

dA7Wsv5-GT62dQKkgt-Z2w.text: During our recent visit to London, we often had breakfast at Mimos Café.  The food was very good and the staff very nice.  Highly recommended!

fiKK8Im3QNXuWOf0HGmUiw.text: Before I write this review.. I shall mention that this was the place we decided to go to after we had horrible service at Peking Seoul. But Wow. Just.. WOW.. This place is kind of like a hole in the wall. Friggin amazing! Me and my friend was craving italian food, and one of the best places I found was Kitchen Italia in Covent Garden, but we didn't want to go out of our way... so we decided to just walk around the Paddington area and found this place.Food:Upon entering, the place looked like any other typical shop.. or so I thought. I sat down and noticed the decor, and the place had a very homely feel. Instantly, we were greeted by the waitress and the chef. They were all VERY VERY helpful. I was friggin starving and wanted to eat, but everything sounded really good. So I ended up asking the waitress and she had recommended  me the Tortalini Funghi 5.45 quid (Tortalini filled with cheese, fresh mushrooms in a creamy sauce.  DELICIOUS. The best I have EVER had. The pasta was fresh as in it was just cooked, and tasted homemade and not straight from the freezer.  Also as a side, I had garlic bread which was 2.50 quid for 4 thick slices that was melt in your mouth delicious! I would recommend asking for a side of pesto and spreading it on top of the bread.The minced meat pastry I thought was decent.. but it felt very filling.My friend had ordered a salami on ciabatta bread. The salami was SUPER fresh and tasty. Every bite was full of goodness.I was very curious how their portions were at their price... but it turned out that we had alot more than what we asked for. Our bill's total turned out to be 20 quid. 10 quid each? Not bad at all.. and we left STUFFED. I would recommend ordering 2 main dishes, garlic bread, and drinks... your bill will be about 14-16 quid. Not a bad deal at all.Service:Top notch. Anything I asked for, was delivered in a reasonable amount of time. I really had appreciated it, because Peking Seoul had me pissed off. They really lightened my mood.There is only one thing I dislike about this place is the restroom accommodation. It's literally in the corner and you have to get past people by asking them to scoot in so you could open the door. I'm sure they could deal with one less table. But that's okay, they still deserve a 5 star rating!

MFV_7XfqycdcjHJ3_5fk1Q.text: After reading a number of reviews we went with very highexpectations. Perhaps that was the problem. The place was bad, it wasn't. Butit sure doesn't deserve to be ranked so high. The food was just food, nothingspecial, nothing creative, no passion, perhaps even a bit bland. And theservice was just average. Not rude but could of been more friendly. This is just a little cafe, there is noatmosphere. The tables are crammed, chairs uncomfortable, it looked a little dirty.For me Mimos was average.

Yp3fgSm8gn4Obk1A-bcM0A.text: From the outside, Mimo's doesn't seem like a place any non-local would would to step foot into. It's not trendy and even looks a bit sketchy with all these scary looking people smoking up front on the street. I only got to check out Mimo's one day because the other Italian restaurant up the street was close and I was craving pasta really bad. The waitress we had was friendly and helpful. The chef was flexible with our choices of side dish.  The service was a bit slow... I think they start boiling the pasta only when you order. The food was good, really good. I totally recommend this place for anyone who craves pasta out there. I had the one with bacon and cream sauce the first time I was there and went back another time for a smoked salmon lemon pasta with cream sauce. Both were rich and delicious. The second time I went with my parents who had steak and thought it was delicious but very fatty. We also tried the banana split which was a thumb down too. Even with that, I still would give them a 4-star for the pasta that gave me such sensation of satisfaction.

ALvp9GCTCWTQG4Fi7ual0w.text: Great All English Breakfast - we enjoyed every bit of it. Price was easygoing as well. Definitely recommend this little joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. All English breakfast, Mimos Cafe

oVql4GqtHQplYU5xIw09cA.text: Fantastic dinner at a great price just walking distance from Paddington Hilton. The menu was pretty extensive and the restaurant very clean!!! Would recommend to everyone.

bPzozE-7t3Lk-yG87DKqKQ.text: Average English breakfast, offering nothing out of the ordinary. However, the quality is above what was being served at one of the local hotels. At about £2.50 less than the hotel for the full breakfast, Mimos Cafe is just fine.

VS9qQWqFr4L8VnB6fnXh8w.text: We came here for the full English breakfast and were not disappointed. Sure, it's crowded, but the food and prices make up for it.

dTHPJz3rz9UQ4x37CrHMDw.text: Great pasta, good service, clean and at a good price... what else can you wish?  How about being close to Paddington station and a little oasis called Norfolk park!   On top of it, the capuchino is excellent and they charged my phone for free!

ZTs2FcwT2QRjUcPHATg-Dg.text: Had a wonderful Full English breakfast and freshly squeezed orange juice! (However, the bacon was a bit on the thick side and thus not very crispy)The place is packed with tables so you could be sitting quite close to eachother.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom

S2oTE9-gxYwIeu18bwsUhw.text: This place looks like the café of a suburban shopping centre was moved to central London, with all the staff and everything. However the unpretentious setting shouldn't fool you: this place serves decent coffee, and a cheap full English brekkie that seems to be quite popular in the area. While you watch a morning show on tv and sip on your coffee the friendly staff will make sure you have all you need. They really seem to care about the quality of service, which is quite surprising considering most customers are not regulars.Will come again and try to talk with strangers.

xO0E6pke8PZPUnKuqOAXzQ.text: Nice little spot very close to Paddington Station. Had a long night of pub crawling with a friend I was visiting down here so I naturally missed my hotels breakfast. Very happy to come across this place while taking a stroll in the rain and discover they still served breakfast (about 2pm). First time having and English breakfast but I fell in love with the beans and cooked tomatoes being served with eggs, bacon, sausage, bacon, and mushrooms. Not sure how the Brits eat it but I enjoyed it all mixed together. Place was small but welcoming and the food and coffee were top notch. Would recommend this spot to anyone in the area needing to take a small break and refuel.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast

3vgvjNNK_lHOUiSHh0Xvjw.text: Decent spot for quick breakfast and coffee. It's a simple cafe, very good service and inexpensive.

_X4DHlMo_tuXX2IXTmSNlw.text: Amazing small Café and restaurant.The service is nice and fast .The breakfast and the meals are very tasty and had a good quality.I can recommend this café

RPOdd6QK2IP1MpMsRc68zA.text: We stayed in one of the boutique hotels a block down and didn't care for the provided breakfast.  We first tried the breakfast right next door, which is in a hotel and has a lovely atmosphere.  Unfortunately their food was expensive, and preparation and sub-par.  Mimos is the exact opposite.  We enjoyed very large portions, and very inexpensive prices.  This was our go-to breakfast for the rest of our stay.  Coffee was good, and the full English was simple and basic, but cooked perfectly.  Best yet, only a few pounds per person.  The only food we had that I would not recommend were the croissants; they are large, but not very good.  Overall, this is a solid choice and and extremely good value for the area.

A2ThJBmnifqPLeu6uhF1LQ.text: Great English breakfast, super basic atmosphere--otherwise nothing overly special.

Cf8xmMfptYS3HTD2qH3nVA.text: Amazing small cafe. Great service. Amazing place for breakfast and coffee. Definitely recommend it.

UvuMMwxE-nSZ1XGKFgvj3w.text: Nice people, very good food at a good price compare the neighbor restaurants in the same area! yeah... small, tight and cozy restaurant , so be prepare to split table if you are coming with more than group of 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom

e3JNegEYjY6trwZZXX7_Nw.text: I visited London for a few days. I ordered a cup of coffee and some food. I waited 45 minutes and the food never show up. Other customers were having the same problem. I paid for the coffee, which was good, and walked away feeling disappointed. The owner was apologetic, and with the cup of good coffee, they avoided a 1-star.

1B_6qfbABbY1T3HILxYHVQ.text: Amazing food & fantastic service. I stayed in a hotel nearby, and ended up having breakfast here three mornings in a row. The full English breakfast is great, and the omelette safe quite good as well. The waitress was very helpful and nice as well, and food was served in a short amount of time. It's a rather small and basic restaurant but it is great food and great service at a great price, would definitely recommend!

8-NMvMyfjucj5_b1AttvOw.text: Fantastic cafe for breakfast, lunch or just a coffee and cake. Staff very friendly and accomodating.

EHuaBhloc6sdXuEqAeJAVg.text: Breakfast is AWESOME and not very expensive. If you stay in the Paddington area then you are lucky!

-NmYaoCZp_I2mGksBqqctA.text: Excellent English breakfast!  House made sausage, roasted tomatoes, nothing bad happening here.  All for a very reasonable price.

xY9XfqGHNjQdl1LVggoPJg.text: Cheap, straight up quality served quickly with no nonsense. Lovely and unlikely right near the station with outside seating. Would definitely go back.

C7UgZpnxt7vYnLA6Fogb_w.text: Breakfast here was not impressive. Sad white toast, poor quality sausage. I'm sure there are better breakfast options nearby.

aojA3u8NlvAjg_qiTuOANw.text: Grabbed a bite to eat here while waiting for a Heathrow Express train to depart. I ordered a vegetarian english breakfast, which was good though the tomatoes were not. Could not determine if it was lack of good tomato season or just because they weren't grilled to be soft. With mushrooms instead of sausages, which were quite tasty. My companion ordered a breakfast set 3, which came with beans, toast, eggs and bacon. Also a very nice value. the food was solidly cooked, the coffee was very good and quick service if you're waiting for a train.

f-UoGdhtK1M32pCbBjVMLw.text: This little wonder of a place is the home of the BEST lasagna I've ever had in my life...and I've had a lot of lasagna. They do it right, with bechamel sauce, which was absolutely fantastic. I was very pleasantly surprised. If you're in the Paddington area, or if you're craving delicious lasagna, stop by Mimo's!

9KLt28JX39_u3oGvL0BgsQ.text: Fantastic Full English breakfast, great service and price. My first breakfast in London early on at Saturday morning. Great way to kick off the day

qu9NQzEV-Pw5leS7DSxiTQ.text: I went to this place because I noticed the cheaper prices so I decided to try it out. The food was not that bad, and for the price I enjoyed what I ordered. Although their food may be good, the service was absolutely horrible. The waitress who helped us was so rude to us and I wasn't sure if it was just how she acted or if it was because I was close to the same age as her and girls can be like that. She never came back to us after she gave us our food and just expected us to know that we had to go up to the till to pay. If you choose to try this place out I would recommend getting it to go so that you don't have to deal with their horrible service.

QVWq2Ab3pwr6CsUjq9wHvg.text: This was right around the corner from the hotel we were staying at (Paddington Apts) and the price for a full english breakfast was (£5.95) and my gosh it was definitely on top of our list! It's a small restaurant so it can get fairly packed, but still, no one complains because of the great food and great price plus with its proximity to Paddington Train Station, you can't really go wrong. Will recommend to anyone visiting London UK!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full english breakfast @ Mimos

SY97f2JJP2_78wq39jm8_Q.text: Had the full breakfast and it was delicious. Everything was cooked perfectly. However, after leaving the restaurant we noticed from the pictures that our plate was missing mushrooms. The restaurant is very busy and packed so they may have forgotten - not very good in term of service. The price was reasonable breakfast for two less than 10 pounds. We'll definitely go again however making sure they don't forget our mushrooms this time.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Decor
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast

wj6roIePuU7Pka75UUQuHQ.text: Really great place for breakfast, brunch and sandwiches! Line up was out the door. Food displayed on the front sandwich and take-out counter looks so good you can't help But to order something, even if you already ate. Came in at 11:00 for breakfast and the place was already packed. Service is friendly despite them being so busy. The wait staff is rushing as fast as they can and you might have to wait so a little patience is required please. Food tastes awesome! I just love these types of breakfasts! BIG plate with my eggs any style, your choice of meats, baked beans and toasted slices of bread. Best way to start your day in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom

ZxJ4zWl746idpreHOWwGqg.text: Had to ask for ever utensil, napkin, menu. I don't know why it's rated so highly on yelp, it was pretty miserable. Maybe the price!

l1JrwgKhlamfjvFb1aCnGA.text: Well, well, well....who knew I could Yelp in London? I just found out I could...so I'm happy to recommend & review this little gem I've frequented several times. Fresh, delicious, easy, & most importantly the staff is funny and kind....and yes the service is great. Check out this little gem. It's become our morning meet up for our friends & family in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Store front....don't miss this wonderful little place.
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. My favorites?...2 fried eggs or the English Breakfast

xMRbCrH_uQBpvcOlORAF1g.text: My mother and I ate here during a recent trip to London. We more or less wandered in looking for some food near our hotel to help us recover from the long flight into the city. And I liked what I saw at Mimos Cafe. Located within walking distance of Paddington Station and the hotels associated with it, I remember Mimos as being a nice, little shop that specialized in a variety of affordable meals. I did not come in for brunch, but for dinner, so my menu primarily listed pastas and sandwiches. Not only are the items affordable, but you get your money's worth from your meals here. For example, a single £4 panini was massive - large enough to be cut into three pieces! - and came with a small side salad, too. It was a lot of food, but it was enjoyable and I found it to be quite refreshing after a night of airline snacks.However, Mimos is admittedly a tiny place, so much so that when people began to come in to the cafe near the end of my meal the bathroom doors were blocked by guests, just due to the placement of the tables in the space that's available to them. With that in mind, it's probably not always the most comfortable of places to eat.That said, I will definitely remember this place - if not for the lovely staff, then for the kind locals who chit-chatted with my mother and I and welcomed us on our first day to the city with open arms. People like this make travel so much fun, and it's wonderful to know that a little cafe has that kind of environment to offer to tired (and yes, sometimes silly) tourists.

ENtMSP1rvUv6aejvtNak5Q.text: Quality, value, and atmosphere.  That sums up Mimo's Cafe.  I stayed at a nearby hotel and thought I'd venture out for breakfast.  Glad I did!  This sits on a small segment of the street that seems to be a local gathering spot.  Not like the other tourist stops around Paddington Station.I sat outside under their awning and had a hearty English breakfast for under 5 pounds.  The experience was rounded out by the animated discourse coming from the group of locals at the Fish & Chips pub 2 doors down.  It was so pleasant that I returned for a pork chop dinner.  Again, something I'd expect when dining with family (okay, some of my family).If you are looking for fine dining at a pristine restaurant, keep looking.  If you are looking for a filling meal at a good price (and not a tourist trap) - then stop here.  For what it is - it is great..

CQ9gtxwzDg4PmBwGnoXCjQ.text: My co-workers and I came here since it was close to the hotel and the reviews were good. The seating was a bit squishy, and there was only one women running around collecting the orders. When we looked at the menu the food was rather inexpensive which was a big plus. I ordered the spaghetti with a meat sauce. Food came in about 15 minutes, and was not very flavorful which was disappointing. Overall just okay food but good value.

ytvRgL4WMW5ie5wZF810pg.text: Quick, great service, Wi-Fi - TV for Wimbledon Watchers but not high volume so good, outdoor seating, indoor seating -home baked goods

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Great Americano - they also have decaf

NNhaBwrcvrqqSHwO_goktg.text: Came here for a Full English Breakfast while on a short trip to London - this is one of the only old school cafes I could find that was open on a Sunday and close to the city center. Full breakfast and tea were both tasty, and pretty cheap as well.

0yQ7Q48rKFYsFGNtsSAE0w.text: A very popular restaurant for breakfast due no doubt to the quality of the food and attentive service. We had scrambled eggs & bacon with coffee. Will be returning for breakfast again tomorrow.

-ZcwyIJ-pMxpH_P65jK7jg.text: A hearty breakfast. Good food, low prices.  5.95 gets you all the food you'll need until dinner.

jWsBGfvQrVM3uyUKnU418g.text: This is definitely my favorite spot in the area. Nothing beats a good english breakfast with a few pounds. Highly recommend to come again

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. awesome english breakfast

8Bpco796rXxdBhuyqYu8Ow.text: Delicious and affordable. Good service and very clean restaurant. We ordered the breakfast combo and latte. The sausage here is amazing! Would recommend eating here

5fRIAGRZXtSNIg8EaCk3hg.text: First time having full English breakfast, and Mimo's Cafe did not disappoint! Quaint little cafe filled with mostly locals. Great espresso as well!

7KMLBxhJSUB2OdISX1-oBw.text: Pretty cheapGood sandwichesIndoor and outdoorAttractive Albanian girl serving food

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Chicken schnitzel
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Tuna baguette

vfv2hJ_KdOszVgfseOdnug.text: Fairly straightforward service in an extremely cramped cafe.  Sister got a latte and an English breakfast #2 (no beans, no blood sausage) and it cost £9. I got a chicken omlette (£6.50) that came with chips (fries.) I thought the omlette would have some flavor but it was simply egg + unseasoned chicken breast. Not bad, but bland and forgettable. Very generous portion of chips that I couldn't finish. I ordered a water that never came and no wait staff came to check on us, so after I paid and left, I went next door and bought a bottle of water. Would have been nice to drink it with my meal, but it's whatever.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast special #2 & latte (9) and a chicken omlette with chips (6.50) 10/25/2018
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Menu 10/25/2018
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Menu 10/25/2018

pMzBSz7YLt9mUKi9TRztiw.text: Great food and service. Cute little shop. Great value in the area. Went w 5 people and the food came out fresh and hot. Waitress Rachel had a lot going on but was attentive. I had the cannellini bean dish which was seasoned well. The spaghetti w/ bolognese sauce was great as was the pasta w/ pesto.  I would recommend eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom

YJeYl7OS77DIv4gy0NvFyg.text: Mimos is run by a boisterous, efficient, and friendly crew, and is an awesome spot to sit down with a reasonably priced meal by yourself and people watch. The wine pours are generous, and so are the portions. I had a tortellini plate and a halloumi salad and I was stuffed as a turkey afterward. I'm wishing I had stopped by for breakfast, too, as I hear they do it well. All of their pastas are solid and at the price in this neighborhood this is truly a gem.

OU2w3PChTjdwkxr6zTbacA.text: One of my favorite places in London. Great food, to a great price. The full english - absolutely delicious. It's a small place though and for that you've got to be there at the right time or lucky to sit where you want or at all. Go there - highly recommend the food.

TYvvYqiQ2G2FLqVZYlRh1Q.text: I came to London for vacation and ate at Mimos for breakfast every day. Love their cappuccino and I had the best waitressYou need to try their ham & cheese omelette. Pure orange juice

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom

Yu4Ay1DPRZxxTaghPAKbiA.text: Food was good. Service was fast. We got the #3 which included the coffee or tea for about £6. It does give you a snapshot of what a traditional English breakfast looks like. 3 meats, toast, beans and egg. The place is pretty small; they definitely make the most out of the space. It's an option for sure that can be affordable.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. #3 Breakfast. Bacon, sausage, burger with beans, egg, mushrooms, tomato and toast. Includes coffee or black tea.

zDRow3sUJ3NBwu9OuR4eew.text: Great breakfast. Great service. There was a line it they moved it quickly and kept everything moving.

pRer7aot4xO8Txr_aR9TlQ.text: A solid cup of coffee, a smaller than expected sandwhich. This place was a happy find on my first day in London. My main complain is that the sandwhiches are too small and not as involved as I would generally expect. The people are nice and the service is great. I would come back here again.

7pFjt3tdvIitKhbTVWVXmA.text: This is a super cute cafe in Paddington with a very friendly staff and regulars. How do I know they were regulars? Well when a regular walked in, they said their name! I was very hungry so I got the full breakfast and a cappuccino! The cappuccino came out the perfect temperature, and was the perfect little pick me up to start my day! The breakfast was delicious, fresh,and filling. I loved the flavor of everything from the mushrooms, to the slightly salty bacon, and buttery toast! I sat inside but there are also a few tables outside as well. This is a must try for a quick breakfast in Paddington!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full breakfast!!!! Delicious and filling!!!
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino!!!

PHIBD09tuww8GUSUspO6Iw.text: Small nice little place. Close to where we stayed service was fast even though it was busy. Food was good only thing the cappuccino could be better.

2YFpUKiLJwgXgEw7SShPLw.text: Small little mom and pop place. Wanted something simple and close to what we would get at home. Their bacon is more like a thin ham steak but was still good. Not bad portion size. Their bathrooms are super tiny.

mOndCcW2GpmO9CkMvF_wvg.text: Breakfast was ok- the server was kind of rude but service was quick. The ham in the breakfast was phenomenal tho! If you want a quick bite to eat for an ok price - I would say stop here. Menu was quite limited for breakfast as well but seemed like a popular locals stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom

RE28ce8BtBtH7sbVTnOxqw.text: Best coffee!! You can sit outside and watch all of Paddington walk by as you savor that awesome coffee they brew here.Great breakfast and pastries too!! Chocolate croissants were nice! All for a very great price. The service is nice and friendly even at their most busy times. I will back next time I'm in Paddington!credit card accepted!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Eggs and bacon (ham), simple but so fresh tasting. Plus a cup of that awesome coffee they brew.
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast for about 7 and the chocolate croissant. Both were excellent!

D3DhhkzVUfsXvIhriZEUSA.text: Definitely a great place for a English breakfast. Comparing to other tourist restaurants where a full breakfast is always over 10 pounds, this small cafe provides you a close or even better quality with only 6 pounds.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom

6NLOqob42j6hO8py-pkLlA.text: This is a super cool cafe with good food.  The chicken curry dish is amazing. The cafe is near the Paddington station and the prices are super affordable for the quality of the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom

FtxE5PSj8E56WcnoXi4rRQ.text: Good breakfast place although we were there for lunch. It was very conveniently located near our hotel and my children were already hungry, so it was the place to go. Service was good and fast. The lady waiter was very kind to us and also had told us if we wanted the marmalade for the toast, its extra to pay. I appreciate her honesty. And she was kind to watch my little daughter as I helped my other daughter to the bathroom.

sPUBZt6bwdIBt-WxcpdlFA.text: It was close to where I'm staying so it was perfect for a quick bite. Dined solo on Saturday morning and they were busy and understaffed so I wasn't served in a timely manner. They gave me the most attention when it came to paying my bill though. I ordered the full English breakfast and it was OK but there was a piece of hair on my sausage. Unfortunately I didn't see it until it was basically too late. Yeah, would not recommend.

tKzxzf_GMWkxt8oykBKE3Q.text: Pretty neat little cafe with good food at reasonable prices. I ordered the linguini salmon while my friend ordered the carbonara, and both were absolutely delicious. The price for each pasta was around £8, which is reasonable given the quality despite the slightly smaller portion. Another friend ordered the pork chop however, and it was not quite as good. Overall the vibes are great and I'd definitely consider revisiting during my 6 day London stay.

s7347I9987O87WHsZuLVLw.text: One of the greatest joys of traveling is the opportunity to enjoy local food at local gems.  And I have to thank a few of my European Yelp buddies who convinced me that this place is indeed a local favorite, despite the fact that it's only a short walk away from the busy and vibrant Paddington Station.This is the kind of mom and pop gems that foodies strive to find each day.  Nothing fancy.  Décor and ambience are not necessary.  Just down-to-earth good food at very reasonable prices.And what a delightful full English breakfast!-- Perfect sunny side up eggs on fried toasts.  Amazing!-- Yummy breakfast banger.  Mildly spiced, slightly sweet, and with a smooth texture.-- Fresh sautéed ham.  Good quality and tasty!-- Baked beans.  I love the English style baked beans as they are more flavorful and not as sweet as their American counterparts.-- Pan-fried tomato. This makes a breakfast truly English... and healthy.-- Sautéed mushrooms.  The final touch of a perfect breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimos Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast.
